snippet: When C. J. Hoppin was 13, living with his family in Japan, he was briefly a bat boy for the Yankees, who were on a six-week tour of the Pacific islands.
abstract: Box Seats article by C J Hoppin recalls being a bat boy for the New York Yankees in 1955 when the players were touring Japan.
lead_paragraph: When C. J. Hoppin was 13, living with his family in Japan, he was briefly a bat boy for the Yankees, who were on a six-week tour of the Pacific islands.

headline.seo: A Dodgers Fan in Yankees Pinstripes in Postwar Japan
headline.main: A Dodgers Fan in Pinstripes in Postwar Japan
headline.print_headline: A Dodgers Fan in Pinstripes In Postwar Japan
